newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Copper and aluminium to test resistance.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Copper and aluminium to test resistance.

text.p: 3 MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Copper and aluminium are expected to probe higher on Wednesday following uptrending chart closes and could possibly overcome resistance levels, traders and chartists said.
Copper is eyeing $2,540 and $2,550, while aluminium may move towards $1,640/$1,650.

COPPER - Building up for a move towards resistance at $2,540 and $2,550 following a constructive chart close on Tuesday. "The 10-day moving average should now provide good support as prices look to challenge the recent highs at $2,548," LME brokers Brandeis said.
Harry Creates of AMT said the market is targeting fanline resistance at $2,550 and possibly $2,570.
On the downside copper should find support at $2,520 and $2,500.
Further support is available from $2,484 down to $2,445.
At 0750 GMT three months LME copper was quoted at $2,533/36, against Tuesday's London close of $2,530/33.

ALUMINIUM - A break above $1,630 could easily move prices towards $1,650, traders and analysts said. "The next level of resistance is placed at $1,650, which we feel is obtainable, on the backdrop of falling stocks coupled with consumers generally operating on a hand to mouth basis," Martin Squires of Rudolf Wolff said.
On the downside market operators pegged support at $1,600 and $1,580.
At 0750 GMT three months aluminium was quoted at $1,623/26, versus $1,618/22.
